section.title: Introduction
section.para: The goal of the ONVIF Test Specification set is to make it possible to realize fully interoperable IP physical security implementations from different vendors. This specification also acts as an input document to the development of a test tool which will be used to test the ONVIF Client implementation conformance towards ONVIF standard. This Client Test Tool analyzes network communications between ONVIF Devices and Clients being tested and determines whether a specific Client is ONVIF conformant (see ONVIF Conformance Process Specification).

This particular document defines test cases required for testing Profile G features of a Client application e.g. Recording Search - Media Search. It also describes the test framework, test setup, prerequisites, test policies needed for the execution of the described test cases.

section.title: Scope
section.para: This ONVIF Profile G Client Test Specification defines and regulates the conformance testing procedure for the ONVIF conformant Clients in the scope of Profile G features. Conformance testing is meant to be black-box network traces analysis and verification. The objective of this specification is to provide the test cases to test individual requirements of ONVIF Clients in the scope of Profile G features according to ONVIF Profile Specifications.

The principal intended purposes are:
Provide self-assessment tool for implementations.
Provide comprehensive test suite coverage for Profile G features.

This specification does not address the following:
3rd parties Client use cases
Non-functional (performance and regression) testing and analysis.
SOAP Implementation Interoperability test i.e. Web Services Interoperability Basic Profile version 2.0 (WS-I BP2.0).
Network protocol implementation Conformance test for HTTPS and HTTP protocols.
The following sections cover test cases needed for the verification of relevant features as mentioned in the ONVIF Profile Specifications.

section.title: Recording Search - Media Search
section.para: Recording Search - Media Search section specifies Client ability to perform operations for finding data of interest within a set of recordings or events on Device.

section.title: Replay Control
section.para: Replay Control section specifies Client ability to control replay of stored video, audio and metadata on Device. This section also specifies Client ability to configure RTSP session timeout.

section.title: Normative references
section.para: ONVIF Profile G Specification version 1.0, Jun 2014:
Rules for the structure and drafting of International Standards, Annex H: Verbal forms for the expression of provisions.

section.title: Conventions
section.para: The key words "shall", "shall not", "should", "should not", "may", "need not", "can", "cannot" in this specification are to be interpreted as described in [ISO/IEC Directives Part 2].

section.title: Definitions
section.para: This section describes terms and definitions used in this document.

listitem.para: See ONVIF Profile Policy.
The Profile G Specification.
Computer appliance or software program that exposes one or multiple ONVIF Web Services.
Computer appliance or software program that uses ONVIF Web Services.
A Conversation is all exchanges between two MAC addresses that contains SOAP request and response.
A network is an interconnected group of devices communicating using the Internet protocol.
Data file created by a network protocol analyzer software (such as Wireshark). Contains network packets data recorded during a live network communications.

SOAP is a lightweight protocol intended for exchanging structured information in a decentralized, distributed environment. It uses XML technologies to define an extensible messaging framework providing a message construct that can be exchanged over a variety of underlying protocols.
ONVIF Client Test Tool that tests ONVIF Client implementation towards the ONVIF Test Specification set.
All streaming data except video and audio, including video analytics results, PTZ position data and other metadata (such as textual data from POS applications).
A container for a set of audio, video and metadata tracks. A recording can hold one or more tracks. A track is viewed as an infinite timeline that holds data at certain times.
An individual data channel consisting of video, audio, or metadata. This definition is consistent with the definition of track in [RFC 2326].
Algorithms or programs used to analyze video data and to generate data describing object location and behaviour.
Device has responded to specific request with code HTTP or RTSP 200 OK and SOAP fault message has not appeared.

section.title: Abbreviations
section.para: This section describes abbreviations used in this document.

listitem.para: Hyper Text Transport Protocol.
Hyper Text Transport Protocol over Secure Socket Layer.
Web Services Description Language.
eXtensible Markup Language.

section.title: Test Overview
section.para: This section provides information for the test setup procedure and required prerequisites that should be followed during test case execution.

An ONVIF Client compliant to the Profile G is an ONVIF Client that can configure, request, and control recording of video data over an IP network from an ONVIF Device compliant to the Profile G. The Profile G also includes support for receiving audio and metadata stream if the Client supports those features.

An ONVIF Profile is described by a fixed set of functionalities through a number of services that are provided by the ONVIF standard. A number of services and functionalities are mandatory for each type of ONVIF Profile. An ONVIF Device and ONVIF Client may support any combination of Profiles and other optional services and functionalities.

section.title: Test Setup
section.para: Collect Network Traces files required by the test cases.
Collect Feature List XML files for Devices detected in the Network Trace files.
Client shall support all mandatory and conditional features listed in the Device Feature List XML file supplied for the Profiles supported by the Client.
For compatibility with the Profile G, the ONVIF Client shall follow the requirements of the conformance process. For details please see the latest ONVIF Conformance Process Specification.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: The pre-requisites for executing the test cases described in this Test Specification include:
The Device shall be configured with an IPv4 address.
The Device shall be able to be discovered by the Client.

section.title: Recording Search - Media Search Test Cases

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to start a search session.

Client is considered as supporting Recording Search - Media Search if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to perform Recording Search using FindRecordings and GetRecordingSearchResults operations AND
Client is able to perform Event Search using FindEvents and GetEventSearchResults operations.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Recording Search - Media Search if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No valid responses for FindRecordings OR
No valid responses for GetRecordingSearchResults OR
No valid responses for FindEvents OR
No valid responses for GetEventSearchResults

If applicable for Client then any of the following conditions shall be met:
Client is able to retrieve Recording Summary using GetRecordingSummary operation OR
Client is able to retrieve Recording Information using GetRecordingInformation operation OR
Client is able to retrieve Media Attributes using GetMediaAttributes operation OR
Client is able to set a search filters using XPath dialect expressions (e.g. for FindEvents operation).

section.para: Test Label: Media Search - Search for Recordings on Device
Test Purpose: To verify that the Client is able to perform recordings search session using FindRecordings and GetRecordingSearchResults operations.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with FindRecordings and GetRecordingSearchResults operations present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes FindRecordings request message to starts a search session, looking for recordings that matches the scope.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and FindRecordingsResponse message.
Client invokes GetRecordingSearchResults request message to receive the results from a recording search session previously initiated by a FindRecordings operation.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetRecordingSearchResultsResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client FindRecordings request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client FindRecordings request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to search.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<FindRecordings>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<FindRecordings>" includes tag: "<Scope>" AND [S3] "<FindRecordings>" includes tag: "<KeepAliveTime>" AND [S4] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S5] Device response contains "<FindRecordingsResponse>" tag AND Client GetRecordingSearchResults request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetRecordingSearchResults request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to search.wsdl) AND [S6] Client request contains "<GetRecordingSearchResults>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S7] "<GetRecordingSearchResults>" includes tag: "<SearchToken>" AND [S8] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S9] Device response contains "<GetRecordingSearchResultsResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Media Search - Search for Events on Device
Test Purpose: To verify that the Client is able to perform events search session using FindEvents and GetEventSearchResults operations.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with FindEvents and GetEventSearchResults operations present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes FindEvents request message to starts a search session, looking for events that matches the search scope.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and FindEventsResponse message.
Client invokes GetEventSearchResults request message to receive the results from a recording search session previously initiated by a FindEvents operation.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetEventSearchResultsResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client FindEvents request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client FindEvents request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to search.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<FindEvents>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<StartPoint>" AND [S3] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<Scope>" AND [S4] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<SearchFilter>" AND [S5] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<IncludeStartState>" AND [S6] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<KeepAliveTime>" AND [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S8] Device response contains "<FindEventsResponse>" tag AND Client GetEventSearchResults request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetEventSearchResults request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to search.wsdl) AND [S9] Client request contains "<GetEventSearchResults>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S10] "<GetEventSearchResults>" includes tag: "<SearchToken>" AND [S11] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S12] Device response contains "<GetEventSearchResultsResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Media Search - Get Recording Summary
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to retrieve Recording Summary using GetRecordingSummary operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetRecordingSummary operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetRecordingSummary request message to get a summary description of all recorded data.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetRecordingSummaryResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetRecordingSummary request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetRecordingSummary request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to search.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetRecordingSummary>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetRecordingSummaryResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Media Search - Get Recording Information
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to retrieve Recording Information using GetRecordingInformation operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetRecordingInformation operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetRecordingInformation request message to retrieve information about a single Recording specified by a RecordingToken.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetRecordingInformationResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetRecordingInformation request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetRecordingInformation request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to search.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetRecordingInformation>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<GetRecordingInformation>" includes tag: "<RecordingToken>" with non-empty string value of specific token AND [S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<GetRecordingInformationResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Media Search - Get Media Attributes
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to retrieve a set of media attributes using GetMediaAttributes operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetMediaAttributes operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetMediaAttributes request message to retrieve a set of media attributes for all tracks of the specified recordings at a specified point in time.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetMediaAttributesResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetMediaAttributes request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetMediaAttributes request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to search.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetMediaAttributes>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<GetMediaAttributes>" includes tag: "<Time>" AND [S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<GetMediaAttributesResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Media Search - SearchFilter specified in FindEvents
Test Purpose: To verify that the Client is able to set a search filters using XPath dialect expressions for FindEvents operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with specified SearchFilter element inside FindEvents request message.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes FindEvents request message to start a search session with specified SearchFilter element that contains the topic and message filter needed to define what events to search for.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and FindEventsResponse message.

section.para: NOTE: If Client FindEvents request message does not contain any value in "<SearchFilter>" tag then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client FindEvents request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client FindEvents request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to search.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<FindEvents>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<StartPoint>" AND [S3] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<Scope>" AND [S4] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<SearchFilter>" AND [S5] "<SearchFilter>" contains any XPath expression AND [S6] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<IncludeStartState>" AND [S7] "<FindEvents>" includes tag: "<KeepAliveTime>" AND [S8] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S9] Device response contains "<FindEventsResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to control replay of stored video, audio and metadata.

Client is considered as supporting Replay Control if the following conditions are met:
Device returns a valid response to GetReplayUri request AND
Client is able to initiate playback of a recorded stream from Device with either of the following encoding types:
MJPEG OR
MPEG4 OR
H264
When Device and Client support reverse playback capability for media streaming:
Client is able to initiate playback using the negative value of Scale header field in RTSP PLAY command.
When Device and Client support configurable RTSP session timeout value of the replay service:
Client is able to change the value using SetReplayConfiguration operation AND
Client is able to retrieve current value using GetReplayConfiguration operation.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Replay Control if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to GetReplayUri request OR
Client is unable to initiate playback of a recorded stream from Device
When Device and Client support reverse playback capability for media streaming:
Client is unable to get valid Device response to RTSP PLAY command with negative value of Scale header field.
When Device and Client support configurable RTSP session timeout value of the replay service:
Client is unable to get valid Device response to SetReplayConfiguration operation OR
Client is unable to get valid Device response to GetReplayConfiguration operation.

section.para: Test Label: Replay Control - Get Replay Uri
Test Purpose: To verify that recorded stream URI from Device is received by Client using the GetReplayUri operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with GetReplayUri operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetReplayUri request message with the following Stream Setup: Stream type element with "RTP-unicast" OR "RTP-multicast" value and Transport Protocol element with "UDP" OR "HTTP" OR "RTSP" value and Recording Token element (indicates the media record selected for replay).
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetReplayUriResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetReplayUri request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetReplayUri request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to replay.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetReplayUri>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<GetReplayUri>" includes tag: "<StreamSetup>" AND [S3] "<StreamSetup>" includes tag: "<Stream>" with ("RTP-unicast" OR "RTP-multicast") value AND [S4] "<StreamSetup>" includes tag: "<Transport>" AND [S5] "<Transport>" includes tag: "<Protocol>" with ("UDP" OR "HTTP" OR "RTSP") value AND [S6] "<GetReplayUri>" includes tag: "<RecordingToken>" with non-empty string value of specified record token AND [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S8] Device response contains "<GetReplayUriResponse>" tag
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Replay Control - MJPEG Replay Recording
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to replay stored recording from Device by using GetReplayUri operation and RTSP commands to establish and then stop media stream with MJPEG encoding type.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with GetReplayUri operation and RTSP DESCRIBE, RTSP SETUP, RTSP PLAY and RTSP TEARDOWN commands present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetReplayUri request message to retrieve URI of stored recording.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetReplayUriResponse message.
Client invokes RTSP DESCRIBE request to retrieve media stream description.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK and SDP information with Media Type: "video" and MIME Type: JPEG.
Client invokes RTSP SETUP request with transport parameter element to set media session parameters.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.
Client invokes RTSP PLAY request to start media stream.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.
Client invokes RTSP TEARDOWN request to terminate the RTSP session.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.

section.para: NOTE: If Device RTSP DESCRIBE response message does not contain Media Type: "video" OR MIME Type: "JPEG" inside SDP information then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetReplayUri request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetReplayUri request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to replay.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetReplayUri>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<GetReplayUri>" includes tag: "<StreamSetup>" AND [S3] "<GetReplayUri>" includes tag: "<RecordingToken>" with non-empty string value of specified record token AND [S4] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S5] Device response contains "<GetReplayUriResponse>" tag AND [S6] "<GetReplayUriResponse>" includes tag: "<Uri>" with valid URI address AND [S7] Client request introduces RTSP DESCRIBE command AND Client RTSP DESCRIBE request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S8] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: URI address obtained from GetReplayUriResponse AND [S9] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S10] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S11] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" [S12] Device response SDP information contains Media Type: "video" and MIME Type: "JPEG" AND [S13] Client request introduces RTSP SETUP command AND Client RTSP SETUP request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S14] RTSP SETUP includes: URI address AND [S15] RTSP SETUP includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S16] RTSP SETUP includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S17] RTSP SETUP includes: "Transport" parameter AND [S18] RTSP SETUP includes: "Require" parameter with "onvif-replay" value AND [S19] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" AND [S20] Client request introduces RTSP PLAY command AND Client RTSP PLAY request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S21] RTSP PLAY includes: URI address AND [S22] RTSP PLAY includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S23] RTSP PLAY includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S24] RTSP PLAY includes: "Session" parameter AND [S25] RTSP PLAY includes: "Require" parameter with "onvif-replay" value AND [S26] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" AND [S27] Client request introduces RTSP TEARDOWN command AND Client RTSP TEARDOWN request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S28] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: URI address AND [S29] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S30] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S31] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: "Session" parameter. [S32] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK".
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Replay Control - MPEG4 Replay Recording
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to replay stored recording from Device by using GetReplayUri operation and RTSP commands to establish and then stop media stream with MPEG4 encoding type.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with GetReplayUri operation and RTSP DESCRIBE, RTSP SETUP, RTSP PLAY and RTSP TEARDOWN commands present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetReplayUri request message to retrieve URI of stored recording.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetReplayUriResponse message.
Client invokes RTSP DESCRIBE request to retrieve media stream description.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK and SDP information with Media Type: "video" and MIME Type: MPEG4.
Client invokes RTSP SETUP request with transport parameter element to set media session parameters.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.
Client invokes RTSP PLAY request to start media stream.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.
Client invokes RTSP TEARDOWN request to terminate the RTSP session.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.

section.para: NOTE: If Device RTSP DESCRIBE response message does not contain Media Type: "video" OR MIME Type: "MPEG4" inside SDP information then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetReplayUri request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetReplayUri request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to replay.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetReplayUri>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<GetReplayUri>" includes tag: "<StreamSetup>" AND [S3] "<GetReplayUri>" includes tag: "<RecordingToken>" with non-empty string value of specified record token AND [S4] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S5] Device response contains "<GetReplayUriResponse>" tag AND [S6] "<GetReplayUriResponse>" includes tag: "<Uri>" with valid URI address AND [S7] Client request introduces RTSP DESCRIBE command AND Client RTSP DESCRIBE request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S8] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: URI address obtained from GetReplayUriResponse AND [S9] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S10] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S11] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" [S12] Device response SDP information contains Media Type: "video" and MIME Type: "MPEG4" AND [S13] Client request introduces RTSP SETUP command AND Client RTSP SETUP request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S14] RTSP SETUP includes: URI address AND [S15] RTSP SETUP includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S16] RTSP SETUP includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S17] RTSP SETUP includes: "Transport" parameter AND [S18] RTSP SETUP includes: "Require" parameter with "onvif-replay" value AND [S19] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" AND [S20] Client request introduces RTSP PLAY command AND Client RTSP PLAY request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S21] RTSP PLAY includes: URI address AND [S22] RTSP PLAY includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S23] RTSP PLAY includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S24] RTSP PLAY includes: "Session" parameter AND [S25] RTSP PLAY includes: "Require" parameter with "onvif-replay" value AND [S26] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" AND [S27] Client request introduces RTSP TEARDOWN command AND Client RTSP TEARDOWN request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S28] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: URI address AND [S29] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S30] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S31] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: "Session" parameter. [S32] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK".
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Replay Control - H264 Replay Recording
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to replay stored recording from Device by using GetReplayUri operation and RTSP commands to establish and then stop media stream with H264 encoding type.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with GetReplayUri operation and RTSP DESCRIBE, RTSP SETUP, RTSP PLAY and RTSP TEARDOWN commands present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetReplayUri request message to retrieve URI of stored recording.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetReplayUriResponse message.
Client invokes RTSP DESCRIBE request to retrieve media stream description.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK and SDP information with Media Type: "video" and MIME Type: H264.
Client invokes RTSP SETUP request with transport parameter element to set media session parameters.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.
Client invokes RTSP PLAY request to start media stream.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.
Client invokes RTSP TEARDOWN request to terminate the RTSP session.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.

section.para: NOTE: If Device RTSP DESCRIBE response message does not contain Media Type: "video" OR MIME Type: "H264" inside SDP information then Test shall be deemed as "NOT DETECTED".
section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetReplayUri request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetReplayUri request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to replay.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetReplayUri>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<GetReplayUri>" includes tag: "<StreamSetup>" AND [S3] "<GetReplayUri>" includes tag: "<RecordingToken>" with non-empty string value of specified record token AND [S4] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S5] Device response contains "<GetReplayUriResponse>" tag AND [S6] "<GetReplayUriResponse>" includes tag: "<Uri>" with valid URI address AND [S7] Client request introduces RTSP DESCRIBE command AND Client RTSP DESCRIBE request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S8] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: URI address obtained from GetReplayUriResponse AND [S9] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S10] RTSP DESCRIBE includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S11] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" [S12] Device response SDP information contains Media Type: "video" and MIME Type: "H264" AND [S13] Client request introduces RTSP SETUP command AND Client RTSP SETUP request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S14] RTSP SETUP includes: URI address AND [S15] RTSP SETUP includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S16] RTSP SETUP includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S17] RTSP SETUP includes: "Transport" parameter AND [S18] RTSP SETUP includes: "Require" parameter with "onvif-replay" value AND [S19] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" AND [S20] Client request introduces RTSP PLAY command AND Client RTSP PLAY request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S21] RTSP PLAY includes: URI address AND [S22] RTSP PLAY includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S23] RTSP PLAY includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S24] RTSP PLAY includes: "Session" parameter AND [S25] RTSP PLAY includes: "Require" parameter with "onvif-replay" value AND [S26] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK" AND [S27] Client request introduces RTSP TEARDOWN command AND Client RTSP TEARDOWN request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S28] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: URI address AND [S29] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S30] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S31] RTSP TEARDOWN includes: "Session" parameter. [S32] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK".
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Replay Control - Reverse Replay
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to initiate a reverse playback of stored recording from Device by using the negative value of Scale header field in RTSP PLAY command.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with RTSP PLAY command with negative value of Scale header field.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes RTSP PLAY command with negative value of Scale header field to start reverse playback.
Device responses with code RTSP 200 OK.

section.literallayout: PASS - [S1] Client request introduces RTSP PLAY command AND Client RTSP PLAY request command has a proper hierarchy (refer to RFC2326 Specification) AND [S2] RTSP PLAY includes: URI address AND [S3] RTSP PLAY includes: "RTSP/*" version identifier AND [S4] RTSP PLAY includes: "CSeq" identifier AND [S5] RTSP PLAY includes: "Session" parameter AND [S6] RTSP PLAY includes: "Require" parameter with "onvif-replay" value AND [S7] RTSP PLAY includes: "Scale" parameter with any negative value (example: "-1.0", "-2", ...) AND [S8] Device response contains "RTSP/* 200 OK"
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Replay Control - RTSP Session Timeout Configuration
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to change the RTSP session timeout configuration of the replay service using SetReplayConfiguration and GetReplayConfiguration operations.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with SetReplayConfiguration and GetReplayConfiguration operations present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes SetReplayConfiguration request with a new duration value of SessionTimeout configuration.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetReplayConfigurationResponse message.
Client invokes GetReplayConfiguration request to verify the current configuration of the replay service.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetReplayConfigurationResponse message with current configuration listed.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetReplayConfiguration request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetReplayConfiguration request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to replay.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetReplayConfiguration>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetReplayConfiguration>" includes tag: "<Configuration>" AND [S3] "<Configuration>" includes tag: "<SessionTimeout>" with non-empty value of duration AND [S4] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S5] Device response contains "<SetReplayConfigurationResponse>" tag AND Client GetReplayConfiguration request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetReplayConfiguration request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to replay.wsdl) AND [S6] Client request contains "<GetReplayConfiguration>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S8] Device response contains "<GetReplayConfigurationResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.title: Recording Control – Dynamic Recording Configurations Test Cases

listitem.para: Client subscribes to device messages using CreatePullPointSubscription operation.
Client creates new Recording.
Client uses Pull Point event mechanism to retrieve notification events from Device.
Client delete Recording.
Client uses Pull Point event mechanism to retrieve notification events from Device.

Client is considered as supporting Dynamic Recording Configurations if the following conditions are met:
When Device and Client support Dynamic Recordings Configurations capability:
Client is able to create a recording using the CreateRecording operation AND
Client is able to delete a recording using the DeleteRecording operation AND
Client is able to retriene notifications about created recordings AND
Client is able to retrive notifications about deleted recordings.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Dynamic Recording Configurations if ANY of the following is TRUE:
When Device and Client support Dynamic Recordings Configurations capability:
No Valid Device Response to CreateRecording request (except soap fault: MaxRecordings) OR
No Valid Device Response to DeleteRecording request (except soap fault: CannotDelete) OR
Client unable to retrieve notifications about created recordings OR
Client unable to retrieve notifications about deleted recordings OR

section.para: Test Label: Dynamic Recording Configurations - create a recording
Feature Under Test: Dynamic Recording Configurations
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to create a new recording on Device by using the CreateRecording operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with CreateRecording operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes CreateRecording request message to create a new recording structure with a track for each supported TrackType.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and CreateRecordingResponse message or device responses with MaxRecordings SOAP fault.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client CreateRecording request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to recording.wsdl) AND Client CreateRecording request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<CreateRecording>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<CreateRecording>" includes tag: "<RecordingConfiguration>" AND ([S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<CreateRecordingResponse>" tag. OR [S5] Device response contains "HTTP/*" with HTTP error status code AND [S6] Device response contains SOAP fault with MaxRecordings fault subcode).
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Dynamic Recording Configurations - delete a recording
Feature Under Test: Dynamic Recording Configurations
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to delete a recording on Device by using the DeleteRecording operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with DeleteRecording operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes DeleteRecording request message to delete a recording.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and DeleteRecordingResponse message or device responses with CannotDelete SOAP fault.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client DeleteRecording request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to recording.wsdl) AND Client DeleteRecording request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<DeleteRecording>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<DeleteRecording>" includes tag: "<RecordingToken>" with non-empty string value of specific recording token AND ([S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<DeleteRecordingResponse>" tag. OR [S5] Device response contains "HTTP/*" with HTTP error status code AND [S6] Device response contains SOAP fault with CannotDelete fault subcode).
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Dynamic Recording Configurations - Retrieve Notifications about created recordings
Feature Under Test: Dynamic Recording Configurations
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to retrieve notifications about created recordings from Device using the Pull Point event mechanism.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with CreatePullPointSubscription, CreateRecording, and PullMessages operations present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes CreatePullPointSubscription message without any filter or with appropriate filter.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and CreatePullPointSubscriptionResponse message.
Client invokes CreateRecording request message to create a new recording structure with a track for each supported TrackType.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and CreateRecordingResponse message or device responses with MaxRecordings SOAP fault.
Client invokes PullMessages command with Timeout and MessageLimit elements
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and PullMessagesResponse message with corresponding event topic value.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client CreatePullPointSubscription request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client CreatePullPointSubscription request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to event.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<CreatePullPointSubscription>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] (Client request does not contain "<Filter>" tag OR [S2] ("<CreatePullPointSubscription>" includes tag: "<Filter>" AND "<Filter>" includes tag: "<TopicExpression>" AND "<TopicExpression>" contains value EITHER ("*:RecordingConfig/CreateRecording" OR "*:RecordingConfig//." OR ) AND [S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<CreatePullPointSubscriptionResponse>" tag AND Client CreateRecording request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to recording.wsdl) AND Client CreateRecording request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S5] Client request contains "<CreateRecording>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S6] "<CreateRecording>" includes tag: "<RecordingConfiguration>" AND [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S8] Device response contains "<CreateRecordingResponse>" tag. Client PullMessages request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client PullMessages request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to event.wsdl) AND [S9] Client request contains "<PullMessages>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S10] "<PullMessages>" includes tag: "<Timeout>" AND [S11] "<PullMessages>" includes tag: "<MessageLimit>" AND [S12] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S13] Device response contains "<PullMessagesResponse>" tag AND [S14] "<PullMessagesResponse>" includes tag: "<NotificationMessage>" AND [S15] "<NotificationMessage>" includes tag: "<Topic>" with value *:RecordingConfig/CreateRecording. OR [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/*" with HTTP error status code AND [S8] Device response contains SOAP fault with MaxRecordings fault subcode.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.title: Recording Control – Dynamic Tracks Configurations Test Cases

listitem.para: Client subscribes to device messages using CreatePullPointSubscription operation.
Client creates new Track.
Client uses Pull Point event mechanism to retrieve notification events about created tracks from Device.
Client delete Track.
Client uses Pull Point event mechanism to retrieve notification events about deleted tracks from Device.

Client is considered as supporting Dynamic Tracks Configurations if the following conditions are met:
When Device and Client support Dynamic Tracks Configurations capability:
Client is able to create a track using the CreateTrack operation AND
Client is able to delete a track using the DeleteTrack operation AND
Client is able to retriene notifications about created tracks AND
Client is able to retrive notifications about deleted tracks.
Client is able to initiate playback using the negative value of Scale header field in RTSP PLAY command.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Dynamic Tracks Configurations if ANY of the following is TRUE:
When Device and Client support Dynamic Tracks Configurations capability:
No Valid Device Response to CreateTrack request (except soap fault: MaxTracks) OR
No Valid Device Response to DeleteTrack request (except soap fault: CannotDelete) OR
Client unable to retrieve notifications about created tracks OR
Client unable to retrieve notifications about deleted tracks OR

section.para: Test Label: Dynamic Tracks Configurations - create a track
Feature Under Test: Dynamic Tracks Configurations
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to create a new track within a recording on Device by using the CreateTrack operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with CreateTrack operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes CreateTrack request message with specified RecordingToken attribute to create a new track structure.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and CreateTrackResponse message or device responses with MaxTracks SOAP fault.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client CreateTrack request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to recording.wsdl) AND Client CreateTrack request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<CreateTrack>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<CreateTrack>" includes tag: "<RecordingToken>" with non-empty string value of specific recording token AND [S3] "<CreateTrack>" includes tag: "<TrackConfiguration>" AND [S4] "<TrackConfiguration>" includes tag: "<TrackType>" with value equals to the strings “Video” OR “Audio” OR “Metadata” AND ([S5] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S6] Device response contains "<CreateRecordingResponse>" tag. OR [S7] Device response contains "HTTP/*" with HTTP error status code AND [S8] Device response contains SOAP fault with MaxTracks fault subcode).
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Label: Dynamic Tracks Configurations - delete a Track
Feature Under Test: Dynamic Tracks Configurations
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to delete a track within a recoding on Device by using the DeleteTrack operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with DeleteTrack operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes DeleteTrack request message with specified RecordingToken attribute to delete a track.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and DeleteTrackResponse message or device responses with CannotDelete SOAP fault.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client DeleteTrack request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to recording.wsdl) AND Client DeleteTrack request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<DeleteTrack>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<DeleteTrack>" includes tag: "<RecordingToken>" with non-empty string value of specific recording token AND [S3] "<DeleteTrack>" includes tag: "<TrackToken>" with non-empty string value of specific track token AND ([S4] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S5] Device response contains "<DeleteTrackResponse>" tag. OR [S6] Device response contains "HTTP/*" with HTTP error status code AND [S7] Device response contains SOAP fault with CannotDelete fault subcode).
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

listitem.para: Client retrieves a list of recordings using GetRecordings operation.
Client retrieves a list of recording jobs using GetRecordingJobs operation.
Client managing recording jobs on a device using CreateRecordingJob and DeleteRecordingJob operations.
Client managing the state of a recording job on a device using GetRecordingJobState and SetRecordingJobMode operations.
Client retrives notifications of the change in a recording job’s state using Pull Point event mechanism.
Client retrives notifications of the change in a recording’s content using Pull Point event mechanism.

Client is considered as supporting Recording Control if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to retrieve a list of recordings using the GetRecordings operation AND
Client is able to retrieve recording jobs using the GetRecordingJobs operation AND
Client is able to manage recording jobs on a device using the CreateRecordingJob and the DeleteRecordingJob operations AND
Client is able to manage the state of a recording job on a device using the GetRecordingJobState and the SetRecordingJobMode operations AND
Client is able to retrive notifications about change of recording job’s state AND
When Device and Client support dynamic update of track/recording content capability:
Client is able to retrive notifications about change of recording’s content.

Client is considered as NOT supporting Recording Control if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No Valid Device Response to GetRecordings request.
No Valid Device Response to GetRecordingJobs request.
No Valid Device Response to CreateRecordingJob request (except soap fault: EITHER MaxRecordingJobs OR MaxReceivers).
No Valid Device Response to DeleteRecordingJob request.
No Valid Device Response to GetRecordingJobState request.
No Valid Device Response to SetRecordingJobMode request.
Client unable to retrieve notifications about change of recording job’s state OR
When Device and Client support dynamic update of track/recording content capability:
Client unable to retrieve notifications about change of recording’s content.

section.para: Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to receive a list of recordings from Device using the GetRecordings operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with GetRecordings operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetRecordings request message.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetRecordingsResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetRecordings request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetRecordings request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetRecordings>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetRecordingsResponse>" tag
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to receive a list of recording jobs from Device using the GetRecordingJobs operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with GetRecordingJobs operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetRecordingJobs request message.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetRecordingJobsResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetRecordingJobs request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetRecordingJobs request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetRecordingJobs>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<GetRecordingJobsResponse>" tag
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to receive a specific recording jobs state from Device using the GetRecordingJobs operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with GetRecordingJobState operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetRecordingJobState request message.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and GetRecordingJobStateResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client GetRecordingJobState request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client GetRecordingJobState request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<GetRecordingJobState>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<GetRecordingJobState>" includes tag: "<JobToken>" with non-empty string value of specific token [S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<GetRecordingJobStateResponse>" tag
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to manag the state of a recording job on Device using the SetRecordingJobMode operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with SetRecordingJobMode operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes SetRecordingJobMode request message.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and SetRecordingJobModeResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client SetRecordingJobMode request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client SetRecordingJobMode request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<SetRecordingJobMode>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<SetRecordingJobMode>" includes tag: "<JobToken>" with non-empty string value of specific token AND [S3] "<SetRecordingJobMode>" includes tag: "<Mode>" AND [S4] "<SetRecordingJobMode>" tag value equals EITHER ("Active" OR "Idle") AND [S5] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S6] Device response contains "<GetRecordingJobStateResponse>" tag
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to create a new recording job on Device by using the CreateRecordingJob operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one conversation between Client and Device with CreateRecordingJob operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes CreateRecordingJob request message.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and CreateRecordingJobResponse message.

section.literallayout:
PASS - Client CreateRecordingJob request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to onvif.xsd) AND Client CreateRecordingJob request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<CreateRecordingJob>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND
[S2] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S3] Device response contains "<CreateRecordingJobResponse>" tag
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.para: Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to delete a recording job on Device by using the DeleteRecordingJob operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with DeleteRecordingJob operation present.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes DeleteRecordingJob request message to delete a recording job.
Device responses with code HTTP 200 OK and DeleteRecordingJobResponse message.

section.literallayout: PASS - Client DeleteRecordingJob request message is a well-formed SOAP request (refer to recording.wsdl) AND Client DeleteRecordingJob request message has a proper hierarchy (refer to recording.wsdl) AND [S1] Client request contains "<DeleteRecordingJob>" tag after the "<Body>" tag AND [S2] "<DeleteRecordingJob>" includes tag: "<JobToken>" with non-empty string value of specific recording job token AND [S3] Device response contains "HTTP/* 200 OK" AND [S4] Device response contains "<DeleteRecordingResponse>" tag.
FAIL - The Client failed PASS criteria.

listitem.para: Added new Test Cases sections: Dynamic Recording Configurations, Dynamic Tracks Configurations, RecordingControl.
No major changes were made, just minor formatting fixes.
No major changes were made, just minor grammatical corrections.
Added Replay Control Test Cases section.
Pass criteria in MEDIASEARCH-6 test case has been updated (removed unnecessary checks of <SearchFilter> tag value).
Added Note to Test Result section of MEDIASEARCH-6 Test Case.
Fixed typos and inconsistencies.
Fixed typos and inconsistencies.
Removed examples of expected Requests and Responses from all Test Cases.
Removed unnecessary PASS criteria from all Test Cases.
"5.1. Expected Scenarios Under Test" section has been updated.
MEDIASEARCH-1 and 2 test cases have been updated.
"3. Terms and Definitions" section has been updated.
Introduced YY.MM method of version numbering.
Initial version
